result.execSummary:
The defendant Austin Jay Cooper was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery with Use of Force [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Restitution is ordered in the amount of $3447.20 to be paid to Vigneshwar S. joint and several with Sarah Parker 15CF1533 and Michael Dunn 15CF1532.

Pay all costs, fees, restitution and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, if not already done, out of up to 25% prison funds and wages, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 3 years initial confinement in this case.
Concurrent with: concurrent to any other sentence, with credit for 238 days time served.

superMiscConds.notes:
Seek and maintain full time employment.
Obtain high school diploma or GED.
Cognitive Behavior Therapy.
Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.

No illegal drugs.
No controlled substances without valid prescription.
No contact with the victim:  Vigneshwar S. and the co-actors: Sarah Parker, Michael Dunn 
No contact with drug community.
Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department. Absolute sobriety. Random urine screens.  No positive results.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms/body armor or weapons.
Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Austin Jay Cooper

records.addlTxt: Signed Earned Release Program/Substance Abuse Program Order faxed to:  (715) 720-3629, and mailed to:  Department of Corrections, Attn:  Records, 2909 E. Park Avenue, Chippewa Falls, WI  54729.  jm
Amendment to Judgment of Conviction and Order -ERP, signed and filed.
DOC is requesting the Court to authorize the inmate's release and conversion of remaining confinement time to extended supervision.  Assigned to Br. 42, Judge Hansher.  jm
records.descr: Pet/determ eligibility for substance abuse program
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Letter to defendant's mother.
Letter from defendant's mother.
Decision and Order DENYING Request to Modify Eligibilty for Early Release Programs, signed filed and signed by the Court.  Copies forwarded to parties.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. William S. Pocan, Br. 26, for review. mag
Defendant's pro se request to modify eligibility for early release programs.

Defendant Austin Jay Cooper in court with attorney Richard E. Poulson.  Defendant Austin Jay Cooper in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms/body armour warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.    

State complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant.  Additional statement by Jeanette D.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 7 years, concurrent to any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 4 years with credit for 238 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 years.

Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:

*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with the victim:  Vigneshwar S. and the co-actors: Sarah Parker, Michael Dunn 
*No contact with drug community.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Obtain high school diploma or GED.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

Restitution is ordered in the amount of $3447.20 to be paid to Vigneshwar S. joint and several with Sarah Parker 15CF1533 and Michael Dunn 15CF1532.

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms/body armour or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs, fees, restitution and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, if not already done, out of up to 25% prison funds and wages, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
- Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 3 years initial confinement in this case.

Appeal rights given.   
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Defense counsel requests motion hearing.    Case adjourned for motion hearing in Branch  26.  Motion hearing scheduled for December 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defense counsel has reviewed discovery and would like additional time to discuss case with client.  Defense counsel requests new date.    Case adjourned for Scheduling Conference, Branch 26.  Scheduling conference scheduled for October 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Richard E. Poulson in court, defendant Austin Jay Cooper not in court, in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel newly appointed, needs discovery and requests scheduling conference.   Case adjourned for Scheduling Conference, Branch 26.  Scheduling conference scheduled for October 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Austin Jay Cooper in court with attorney Douglas E. Batt.  Defendant Austin Jay Cooper in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Counsel informed Court there has been a breakdown in communication.  Defense motion to withdraw as counsel is granted by the court.  Defense counsel will notify Public Defender's Office to appoint new counsel for the defendant.  Court advised defendant this will be the last public defender appointed.  Case adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 26.  Status conference scheduled for October 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
COURT FILE RETAINED IN COURT.

Parties in court to reschedule final pretrial conference and jury trial.  Defense counsel informed the Court his client would like a motion hearing also.   Case is adjourned for Motion/Final Pretrial Conference and Jury Trial, Branch 26.

Defendant Austin Jay Cooper in court with attorney Douglas E. Batt.  Defendant Austin Jay Cooper in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Frederick Klimetz also in court.  Defense counsel has reviewed the motion to suppress received by the Court on September 8, 2015 that his client filed on his own.  Defense informs the Court that there is no basis for the motion and it has no merit.  Motion hearing scheduled for September 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for December 14, 2015 at 09:00 am.
COURT FILE RETAINED IN COURT.

Defendant Austin Jay Cooper in court with attorney Douglas E. Batt.  Defendant Austin Jay Cooper in custody.  Lucy Kronforst for James Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Case heard for Br. 26.   Parties acknowledge receipt of a copy of the doctor's report.  Parties do not challenge the report.  Based on report, Court finds the defendant competent to proceed.  Court orders the proceedings and $5,000 cash bail reinstated TOT to Justice Point with the same conditions.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.
From Dr. Engen received and filed. tk

Defendant Austin Jay Cooper in court with attorney Douglas E. Batt. James Griffin on behalf of Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.  
Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for May 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION INCLUDING DRUG TESTING.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription AND no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Vigneshwar S., ANY Day's Inn, George A., Southridge Mall, Dana G., Dustin G., Joseph J., James G., Remi C. and Co-defendants SARAH PARKER, MIchael Dunn.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Austin Jay Cooper in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Austin Jay Cooper in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge POCAN, Branch 26.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.

Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wis. Stats. Section 165.77(4).

  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
